meanings.definition: To render insensible or lethargic by means of a narcotic substance.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will narcotise the patient before the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The medication will narcotise the pain in my arm.
meanings.sent3: After taking the medicine, I felt like I could narcotise all my worries away.
meanings.sent4: The peaceful music seemed to narcotise my mind into a dreamlike state.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotic rhythm of the waves began to narcotise me into a deep sleep.

meanings.definition: To dull or deaden the senses or feelings.
meanings.sent1: The strong scent of the flowers narcotised my sense of smell.
meanings.sent2: The monotonous task began to narcotise my enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The boring lecture threatened to narcotise the entire class.
meanings.sent4: The gray sky seemed to narcotise my mood into a state of melancholy.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the clock ticking began to narcotise my awareness of time passing.
